definitions.definition: having been defeated.
examples: I knew when I was beaten

definitions.definition: exhausted and dejected.
examples: he sat feeling old and beaten

definitions.definition: having been beaten or struck.
examples: he trudged home like a beaten dog

definitions.definition: (of food) whipped to a uniform consistency.
examples: beaten eggs
synonyms: foamy "gradually stir in the beaten eggs"

definitions.definition: (of metal) shaped by hammering, typically so as to give the surface a dimpled texture.
(of precious metal) hammered to form thin foil for ornamental use.
(of a path) well trodden; much used.
examples: trodden, trampled; Morewell trodden, much trodden, well used, much traveled, worn, well worn "a beaten path"Morewell trodden, much trodden, well used, much traveled, worn, well worn a beaten path

definitions.definition: strike (a person or an animal) repeatedly and violently so as to hurt or injure them, usually with an implement such as a club or whip.
examples: a woman whose husband would frequently beat her after becoming drunk
synonyms: beat the living daylights out of; datedchastise "they were beaten with truncheons"

definitions.definition: strike (an object) repeatedly so as to make a noise.
examples: he beat the table with his hand
synonyms: drum; pitter-patter "her heart was still beating"

definitions.definition: (of an instrument) make a rhythmical sound by being struck.
examples: drums were beating in the distance

definitions.definition: strike (a carpet, blanket, etc.) repeatedly in order to remove dust.
flatten or shape (metal) by striking it repeatedly with a hammer.
examples: pure gold can be beaten out to form very thin sheets
synonyms: model "the metal is beaten into a die"

definitions.definition: strike something against (something).
examples: she beat her fists against the wood

definitions.definition: strike repeatedly on.
examples: Sidney beat on the door with the flat of his hand

definitions.definition: make striking movements toward.
examples: Emmie seized the hearthrug and began to beat at the flames

definitions.definition: move across (an area of land) repeatedly striking at the ground cover in order to raise game birds for shooting.
defeat (someone) in a game, competition, election, or commercial venture.
examples: she beat him easily at chess
synonyms: skunk "the team they need to beat"

definitions.definition: baffle.
examples: it beats me how you manage to work in this heat

definitions.definition: overcome (a problem, or disease).
examples: they are investing their savings in hopes of beating inflation

definitions.definition: do or be better than (a record or score).
examples: he beat his own world record

definitions.definition: be better than.
examples: you can't beat the taste of fresh raspberries

definitions.definition: succeed in getting somewhere ahead of (someone).
examples: I could beat him on my bicycle

definitions.definition: take action to avoid (difficult or inconvenient effects of an event or circumstance).
examples: they set off early to beat the traffic

definitions.definition: (of the heart) pulsate.
examples: her heart beat faster with panic

definitions.definition: (of a bird) move (the wings) up and down.
examples: flap, flutter, thresh, thrash, wave, vibrate, oscillate the eagle beat its wings

definitions.definition: (of a bird) fly making rhythmic wing movements.
examples: an owl beat low over the salt marsh

definitions.definition: stir (cooking ingredients) vigorously with a fork, whisk, or beater to make a smooth or frothy mixture.
examples: whisk, mix, blend, whip beat the cream into the mixture

definitions.definition: leave.
examples: now beat it, will you!

definitions.definition: sail into the wind, following a zigzag course with repeated tacking.
examples: we beat southward all that first day
